metadata.title: CVE-2021-47244 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: mptcp:Fix out of bounds when parsing TCP options The TCP option parser in mptcp(mptcp_get_options) could read one byte out of bounds. When the length is1, the execution flow gets into the loop, reads one byte of the opcode, andif the opcode is neither TCPOPT_EOL nor TCPOPT_NOP, it reads one more byte,which exceeds the length of 1. This fix is inspired by commit 9609dad263f8("ipv4: tcp_input: fix stack out of bounds when parsing TCP options.").

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-47244` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1003-fips - 4.4.0-1098.105
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips-updates/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1098.105').
